prompt.text: Hi! I'm LabAssistant. Let us wait until both teammates have joined the discussion.
Once everyone is ready, we'll tackle four different parts of our experiment in the Virtual Lab.

Part 1 - Mix A and B and use the species viewer to determine the stoichiometry of the reaction between A and B, including the stoichiometric coefficients. You will find 1 M solutions of each reagent in the stockroom. Talk it through together.

Compare notes before you lock in an answer. What observations or tests support your Part 1 reaction? Use the document in the "Scratchpad" tab to record your observations. When each teammate is ready, type ready:part1.
Send me your reaction as reaction: REACTANTS->PRODUCTS (e.g. reaction: X+Y->Z). You have up to three tries, so double-check before you submit.
Your reactants are correct. Revisit the products to reach the correct equation.
Your products are correct. Check which reactants should combine to produce these products.

This reaction is incorrect. Re-examine both the reactants and the products before trying again.
Great! Your Part 1 reaction is correct!.

We'll reveal the Part 1 solution and keep moving.
Part 1 solution: A + B -> 2C. Review the walkthrough at https://munano.org/chem-pilot-01-simple/ to reinforce the concept.
